column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Coles is collaborating with industry partners, which is vital to delivering on our goal to support customers to make healthier choices. We partner with the Fruit and Vegetable Consortium (FVC), which brings together organisations such as Coles, AUSVEG, CSIRO and Nutrition Australia to consider ways to improve the health of all Australians by increasing their fruit and vegetable intake.
column20: Fruit and Vegetable Consortium (FVC), Coles, AUSVEG, CSIRO, Nutrition in Australia

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: To help encourage our customers to increase their consumption of fruit and vegetables, we continue to prioritise labelling of serves of fruit and vegetables on eligible Coles Own Brand products. In FY23, we highlighted 298 million servings of fruit and vegetables via on-pack labelling. In addition, we added Health Star Ratings (HSR) plus health and nutrition claims onto fresh produce to further highlight the benefits.
column20: Fruit and Vegetable Consumption, Coles Own Brand, Health Star Ratings

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: We continued to expand our Coles PerForm sports nutrition range Ã¢ÂÂ developed in partnership with Sports Dietitians Australia Ã¢ÂÂ to 70 products to fuel our customers' fitness goals. In addition to updating the existing PerForm frozen and chilled ready-meal ranges, we have introduced salad bowls, fresh pasta and pasta sauce, electrolyte drinks and electrolyte powder. In FY23, we launched 27 new products, expanding the PerForm brand by over 30%.
column20: Coles PerForm Sport Nutrition, Sports Dietitians Australia, Fitness Goals

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: To help our customers live healthier, happier lives, Coles launched Joyful, a new low-sugar snack brand. The Joyful range of bars contains less than 2g of sugar per serve, has an HSR of 3 or above and highlights other nutrition benefits such as providing a source of fibre or protein. A selection of bars in the range are also gluten-free or vegan-friendly. In FY23, we launched our Coles Own Brand Happy Gut range of packaged breads and English muffins. All products within the range contain prebiotic fibre to support gut health, are rich in fibre, vegan and have an HSR of 4 or above.
column20: Joyful, HSR, Coles Own Brand Happy Gut

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: We have increased our range of plant-based products as our customers seek more vegan, vegetarian and flexitarian options. In FY23, we launched various Coles vegan-friendly products across our supermarkets, including meat-free minces, cauliflower pizza bases, chia pudding mixes, banana bread slices and nutritional yeast seasoning. Since launching in 2019, Coles NatureÃ¢ÂÂs Kitchen Plant-Based range has grown to 47 products across the store.
column20: Plant-Based Innovation, Vegan and Vegetarian, Cauliflower Pizza Bases, Banana Bread Slices

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In FY23, Coles and the SAKGF launched two initiatives to inspire young people to eat more fresh fruit and vegetables and reduce environmental impacts. The Ã¢ÂÂExplore a FarmÃ¢ÂÂ program takes school students to a farm to learn how fruit and vegetables move from the paddock to the shelf.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: A free animated eBook Ã¢ÂÂGrow It, Cook ItÃ¢ÂÂ features gardening tips and seasonal growing and harvesting information. Since the launch of the partnership with the SAKGF in 2020, Coles has donated more than $1.6 million and partnered with over 70 Coles supermarket stores with local Kitchen Garden Program schools to empower more young Australians to grow, harvest, prepare and share.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Launched a new national self-exclusion process for all retail liquor stores to help customers manage their relationship with alcohol. The ability to self-exclude from the online purchase and delivery of alcohol is already in place across the country by the Retail Drinks Australia Online Alcohol Sale and Delivery Code of Conduct.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Coles worked closely with key government and community stakeholders in Darwin and Alice Springs in the Northern Territory to introduce alcohol restrictions and security and safety measures due to escalating crime and anti-social behaviour in the community. It included measures such as putting purchase limits on alcohol products and placing all spirits behind lockable glass in stores.
column20: Darwin and Alice Springs, Northern Territory, Alcohol Restrictions

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Coles aims to help minimise the harm associated with the misuse and abuse of alcohol. Coles engaged with the New South Wales Police to develop a campaign for retail liquor stores to educate customers on the risks associated with supplying alcohol to minors.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Coles aims to help minimise the harm associated with the misuse and abuse of alcohol. We contributed to developing educational materials highlighting support services and resources to assist people in managing alcohol consumption. It also emphasised customers Ã¢ÂÂchoosing to DrinkWiseÃ¢ÂÂ and Coles Liquor promoting no and low-alcohol products, with the number of products increasing by 43% in FY23.

column7: ColesÃ¢ÂÂ Political Donations Policy prohibits any donation on behalf of Coles to political parties, political organisations, politicians, local councillors, candidates for public office or any Public Official. Paid attendance at an event hosted by a political party is only permitted in limited circumstances, with approval and record keeping of the event, as set out in the policy.\n

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: In 2000, Western AustraliaÃ¢ÂÂs Ã¢ÂÂWestern Rock Lobster FisheryÃ¢ÂÂ was the first fishery in the world to be Marine Stewardship Council (MSC) certified. In November 2022, it became the first fishery to be approved for a record fifth time. Coles is the only supermarket in Australia to offer MSC-certified seafood at all our deli counters, including the Western Rock Lobster, selling close to 140,000 kg in FY23. It joins a range of MSC-certified products with the MSC label available in our fresh, frozen and canned content.
column20: Western Australia, Western Rock Lobster Fishery, Marine Stewardship Council, MSC-Certified

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning the health and safety impacts of products and services
column7: Our product safety program covers non-food products. We work closely with suppliers concerning compliance with relevant mandatory standards and consumer guarantees under Australian Consumer Law.

column6: Requirements for product and service information and labeling
column7: Products identified as unsafe or defective are withdrawn and recalled. Coles works with suppliers to support their corrective actions and to mitigate recurrences. During FY23, four Coles Own Brand products were recalled due to undeclared allergens (milk) and microbiological contamination. In response, we issued public communications and worked with regulators and suppliers to promptly mitigate any associated issues.
